subject: p13849733
Findings: A moderate-sized, loculated right pleural effusion is similar when compared to the prior study, though a small left pleural effusion appears to be new in the interval. Again demonstrated is volume loss in the left lung with leftward shift of mediastinal structures and unchanged architectural distortion, bronchiectasis, and pleural thickening involving the left upper lobe. Right basilar hazy opacity likely reflects compressive atelectasis. Streaky opacity within the left lung base may also reflect an area of atelectasis. There is no pneumothorax. No acute osseous abnormality is seen. There is no pulmonary vascular congestion, and the cardiomediastinal silhouette is stable.
Impression: Unchanged moderate loculated right pleural effusion, with new small left pleural effusion. Bibasilar airspace opacities likely reflect atelectasis. Evidence of prior granulomatous infection.
